page.title: 02Changes in Panfield.
page.content: We interviewed{Mrs Wildish}who has lived in{Panfield}for 40 years. Not many houses had mains water supply in{1940,}so Mrs Wildish had to get water from the pump in the garden next door. The majority of houses were in {Hall Road.}Now Hall Road is less important. There are many new houses along{Kynastan Road.}In{1953}Mrs Wildish named{Queens Gardens. St Marys {Close, Ketleys View, Queens Gardens and{Meadow Close}were all built about the same time. There were more buses, both early and late. There was a bus at 7.00 am which went to{Bocking}via{Courtauld's {factory,}where many people from {Panfield}worked. Forty years ago there was one{village shop}which shut for a few years and then reopened as a{post {office}and{general store.
